title: [K-12] AI Image Generation Tool-Based Math-Design Convergence Workshop for Landscape Architecture Education: Geometric Analysis and Spatial Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary landscape design concepts, smartphone proficiency, basic geometry (area and angle calculations), ratio comprehension, and foundational knowledge of coordinate systems and equations
context.additional_context: A non-degree education course for pre-service/in-service teachers. Includes activities exploring integration possibilities with mathematics curriculum (mathematical modeling, spatial reasoning, statistical analysis) alongside design thinking training. Particularly emphasizes design validity verification methods through mathematical proofs.

learning_goals: Learners can utilize at least three AI image generation tools (e.g., Adobe Firefly, Bing Image Creator, Midjourney) to analyze and visualize the geometric structures (proportions, symmetry, patterns) of landscape design concepts using mathematical formulas (e.g., golden ratio, trigonometric functions).

Learners can measure and calculate spatial components (area, volume, angles) of generated AI images and propose at least two actionable strategies for the design process (e.g., optimal space arrangement using coordinate systems, resource allocation planning applying proportional equations).

Learners can develop prototypes (sketches, models, digital renderings) applicable to school landscape design projects (e.g., gardens, rest areas) using 3â€“5 images generated from experiential learning activities (e.g., nature observation, digital modeling) and utilize mathematical tools (coordinate systems, ratio calculations, equations) within 6 months.

resources: AI image generation web tool access permission
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
